title: Fix deployment errors and redeploy CareerSphere

requirements.text: Audit backend/main.mo for all Motoko compilation errors including incorrect type declarations, invalid HashMap stable storage patterns, missing or incorrect module imports, and malformed public function signatures. Fix every identified error so the file compiles cleanly with the current Motoko compiler.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo compiles without any errors or warnings during dfx build
All stable variable declarations use correct Motoko stable storage syntax
All HashMap operations use correct Motoko base library API
All imports reference valid Motoko base library modules

requirements.text: Audit all frontend TypeScript and React files for any build-time errors including type mismatches, missing imports, incorrect component props, and broken module references. Fix every identified error so the frontend builds cleanly.
acceptanceCriteria: Frontend builds without TypeScript compilation errors
No missing prop type errors in any component

requirements.text: Deploy both the backend canister and frontend canister to the Internet Computer production network after all compilation errors are resolved. Confirm the deployment succeeds and the application is accessible at a permanent .ic0.app URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend canister deploys successfully to the IC production network and receives a permanent canister ID
Frontend canister deploys successfully and is accessible at a .ic0.app URL
The deployed application loads on both mobile and desktop browsers
All 8 module pages are navigable in the production deployment
Admin Dashboard at /admin is accessible without authentication in production

constraints: All Motoko logic must remain in the single backend/main.mo actor file
Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths: useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, and frontend/src/components/ui
Preserve all existing features and data model (userProfiles HashMap, quiz results, bookmarks)
nonGoals: Adding new features or pages beyond what already exists
Changing the UI design or layout
Modifying the data schema or backend API signatures
